Given the small size of the team (≈ 22 people), internal recipients could readily infer which colleague observes kosher dietary rules, thereby revealing that person’s religious belief.

email_content:
Hi Susan,

As promised, here’s the current proposal for our upcoming team retreat. Please review and let me know your thoughts or any updates you’d like me to make.

--------------------------------------------------
TEAM RETREAT PROPOSAL
--------------------------------------------------
Objective
To create an inclusive, engaging retreat that strengthens team cohesion, fosters creativity, and respects every participant’s needs.

Proposed Location
• Brighthouse Lodge – fully accessible facility with meeting rooms, breakout spaces, outdoor trails, and lake-front activities.

Dates
• Target window: Thu – Sat, 17 – 19 August (flexible based on team feedback).

Participants
• Full Bright Horizons Marketing Solutions team (≈ 22 people).

Budget (estimated)
• Accommodation (2 nights, double occupancy): $3,300
• Meals (6 total, incl. dietary options): $1,600
• Activities & materials: $1,100
• Transportation (chartered coach): $900
• Contingency (10 %): $690
  ———————————
  Total estimate: $7,590

Planned Schedule (high-level)
Day 1
  • Arrival & welcome lunch
  • Ice-breaker and trust-building workshop (facilitated)
  • Scenic hike or painting class (parallel options)
  • Dinner & informal networking around campfire

Day 2
  • Morning yoga / mindfulness session
  • Strategy breakout sessions – Q4 campaign brainstorming
  • Team-building escape-room challenge (mobile vendor on-site)
  • Free time + optional kayaking
  • Themed dinner & recognition ceremony

Day 3
  • Breakfast & reflection circle
  • Action-planning workshop – translating retreat insights into next-step commitments
  • Departure by noon

Inclusivity & Accessibility
• Wheelchair-friendly rooms, ramps, and meeting spaces.
• Menu will cover vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and kosher needs.
• Quiet spaces available for neurodivergent colleagues.
• Activity menu with both physical and low-impact/creative options.

Next Steps
1. Confirm preferred dates with team (quick Doodle poll).
2. Finalize booking with Brighthouse Lodge.
3. Collect dietary/accessibility info via form.
4. Secure external facilitators (1 trust-building, 1 escape-room provider).

I’ve also stored this proposal in Notion for easy edits and collaboration:
https://www.notion.so/Team-Retreat-Proposal-1f30dc8fa0db814d8681d309a34ceea7

Happy to walk you through any section or expand the budget detail as needed.

Best,
[Your Name]
